entries.detail: /Users/galhadida/projects/builder_project/builder_program/.auto-claude/worktrees/tasks/038-create-form-input-components

1â†’# Specification: Create Form Input Components
     2â†’
     3â†’## Overview
     4â†’
     5â†’Build a reusable set of form input components for the Builder project that provides a consistent API and styling across all forms. These components will wrap Material UI base components with custom styling, validation patterns, and accessibility features to streamline form development throughout the application.
     6â†’
     7â†’## Workflow Type
     8â†’
     9â†’**Type**: feature
    10â†’
    11â†’**Rationale**: This task introduces new reusable components to the codebase that will enhance the form development workflow across the application. It's a foundational feature that establishes patterns for future form implementations.
    12â†’
    13â†’## Task Scope
    14â†’
    15â†’### Services Involved
    16â†’- **frontend** (primary) - React/TypeScript service where components will be created
    17â†’
    18â†’### This Task Will:
    19â†’- [ ] Create a TextInput component for single-line text entry
    20â†’- [ ] Create a TextareaInput component for multi-line text entry
    21â†’- [ ] Create a SelectInput component for dropdown selections
    22â†’- [ ] Create a CheckboxInput component for boolean inputs
    23â†’- [ ] Create a DatePickerInput component for date selection
    24â†’- [ ] Create a FileUploadInput component for file uploads
    25â†’- [ ] Ensure all components support validation and error states
    26â†’- [ ] Implement consistent styling using Emotion
    27â†’- [ ] Add TypeScript interfaces for all component props
    28â†’- [ ] Include accessibility features (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
    29â†’
    30â†’### Out of Scope:
    31â†’- Form state management library integration (Formik, React Hook Form, etc.)
    32â†’- Backend validation logic
    33â†’- Complex composite form components (e.g., address fields, credit card inputs)
    34â†’- Form submission handling
    35â†’- Internationalization of error messages
    36â†’
    37â†’## Service Context
    38â†’
    39â†’### Frontend
    40â†’
    41â†’**Tech Stack:**
    42â†’- Language: TypeScript
    43â†’- Framework: React
    44â†’- Build Tool: Vite
    45â†’- Styling: Emotion (CSS-in-JS)
    46â†’- UI Library: Material UI (@mui/material)
    47â†’- Additional Libraries:
    48â†’  - @mui/x-date-pickers (for date picker)
    49â†’  - react-dropzone (for file upload)
    50â†’  - dayjs (date manipulation)
    51â†’
    52â†’**Entry Point:** `src/App.tsx`
    53â†’
    54â†’**How to Run:**
    55â†’```bash
    56â†’npm run dev
    57â†’```
    58â†’
    59â†’**Port:** 3000
    60â†’
    61â†’## Files to Modify
    62â†’
    63â†’| File | Service | What to Change |
    64â†’|------|---------|---------------|
    65â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/TextInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new text input component |
    66â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/TextareaInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new textarea component |
    67â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/SelectInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new select dropdown component |
    68â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/CheckboxInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new checkbox component |
    69â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/DatePickerInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new date picker component |
    70â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/FileUploadInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new file upload component |
    71â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/index.ts` | frontend | Export barrel file for all form components |
    72â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/types.ts` | frontend | Shared TypeScript interfaces for form components |
    73â†’
    74â†’## Files to Reference
    75â†’
    76â†’These files show patterns to follow:
    77â†’
    78â†’| File | Pattern to Copy |
    79â†’|------|----------------|
    80â†’| `frontend/src/App.tsx` | TypeScript component structure and imports |
    81â†’| Existing Material UI usage in codebase | Component composition with MUI |
    82â†’| `frontend/package.json` | Available dependencies (@mui/material, @mui/x-date-pickers, react-dropzone) |
    83â†’
    84â†’## Patterns to Follow
    85â†’
    86â†’### Material UI Component Composition
    87â†’
    88â†’The project uses Material UI as the base component library. Components should:
    89â†’
    90â†’**Key Points:**
    91â†’- Wrap Material UI components rather than building from scratch
    92â†’- Use Emotion for custom styling via `styled` or `sx` prop
    93â†’- Support all standard Material UI props via prop spreading
    94â†’- Follow controlled component pattern for form inputs
    95â†’
    96â†’### TypeScript Prop Interfaces
    97â†’
    98â†’All components must have strongly typed props:
    99â†’
   100â†’```typescript
   101â†’interface TextInputProps {
   102â†’  label: string;
   103â†’  value: string;
   104â†’  onChange: (value: string) => void;
   105â†’  error?: string;
   106â†’  helperText?: string;
   107â†’  required?: boolean;
   108â†’  disabled?: boolean;
   109â†’  placeholder?: string;
   110â†’  // ...spread Material UI TextField props
   111â†’}
   112â†’```
   113â†’
   114â†’**Key Points:**
   115â†’- Use optional props for non-required fields
   116â†’- Include error and helperText for validation feedback
   117â†’- Allow Material UI props to be passed through
   118â†’
   119â†’### Emotion Styling
   120â†’
   121â†’Components should use Emotion for styling consistency:
   122â†’
   123â†’```typescript
   124â†’import styled from '@emotion/styled';
   125â†’
   126â†’const StyledTextField = styled(TextField)`
   127â†’  /* Custom styles here */
   128â†’`;
   129â†’```
   130â†’
   131â†’**Key Points:**
   132â†’- Use the `styled` function from @emotion/styled
   133â†’- Maintain theme consistency
   134â†’- Support responsive design
   135â†’
   136â†’## Requirements
   137â†’
   138â†’### Functional Requirements
   139â†’
   140â†’1. **TextInput Component**
   141â†’   - Description: Single-line text input field
   142â†’   - Props: label, value, onChange, error, helperText, placeholder, required, disabled
   143â†’   - Acceptance: Can render, accept input, display errors, and handle validation states
   144â†’
   145â†’2. **TextareaInput Component**
   146â†’   - Description: Multi-line text input field
   147â†’   - Props: label, value, onChange, error, helperText, placeholder, required, disabled, rows, maxRows
   148â†’   - Acceptance: Supports multiple lines, auto-resizing, character count display (optional)
   149â†’
   150â†’3. **SelectInput Component**
   151â†’   - Description: Dropdown selection component
   152â†’   - Props: label, value, onChange, options (array of {label, value}), error, helperText, required, disabled, multiple
   153â†’   - Acceptance: Renders dropdown, handles single/multiple selection, displays selected values
   154â†’
   155â†’4. **CheckboxInput Component**
   156â†’   - Description: Boolean checkbox input
   157â†’   - Props: label, checked, onChange, error, helperText, required, disabled
   158â†’   - Acceptance: Toggles on/off, shows checked state, supports indeterminate state
   159â†’
   160â†’5. **DatePickerInput Component**
   161â†’   - Description: Date selection component using Material UI Date Picker
   162â†’   - Props: label, value (Date or null), onChange, error, helperText, required, disabled, minDate, maxDate
   163â†’   - Acceptance: Opens calendar picker, allows date selection, validates date ranges
   164â†’
   165â†’6. **FileUploadInput Component**
   166â†’   - Description: File upload component using react-dropzone
   167â†’   - Props: label, value (File or File[]), onChange, error, helperText, required, disabled, accept (file types), multiple, maxSize
   168â†’   - Acceptance: Drag-and-drop support, file type validation, size validation, shows selected files
   169â†’
   170â†’### Edge Cases
   171â†’
   172â†’1. **Validation Errors** - All components must display error messages clearly below the input
   173â†’2. **Disabled State** - All components must visually indicate disabled state and prevent interaction
   174â†’3. **Required Fields** - Components should show required indicator (asterisk) when required=true
   175â†’4. **Empty Values** - Components should handle null/undefined values gracefully
   176â†’5. **Long Text** - TextInput and SelectInput should handle overflow with ellipsis
   177â†’6. **File Upload Limits** - FileUploadInput should prevent uploads exceeding maxSize
   178â†’7. **Date Validation** - DatePickerInput should prevent selection outside min/max range
   179â†’
   180â†’## Implementation Notes
   181â†’
   182â†’### DO
   183â†’- Use Material UI components as the foundation (@mui/material)
   184â†’- Use @mui/x-date-pickers for the DatePickerInput component
   185â†’- Use react-dropzone for FileUploadInput drag-and-drop functionality
   186â†’- Implement consistent error handling across all components
   187â†’- Add ARIA labels for accessibility
   188â†’- Support keyboard navigation
   189â†’- Export all components from `frontend/src/components/forms/index.ts`
   190â†’- Create shared types in `frontend/src/components/forms/types.ts`
   191â†’- Use controlled component pattern (value + onChange)
   192â†’
   193â†’### DON'T
   194â†’- Install new dependencies (all required libraries are already installed)
   195â†’- Create form state management (components should be controlled by parent)
   196â†’- Implement backend validation (client-side only)
   197â†’- Override Material UI theme globally
   198â†’- Create complex composite components in this task
   199â†’
   200â†’## Development Environment
   201â†’
   202â†’### Start Services
   203â†’
   204â†’```bash
   205â†’# Frontend
   206â†’cd frontend
   207â†’npm run dev
   208â†’```
   209â†’
   210â†’### Service URLs
   211â†’- Frontend: http://localhost:3000
   212â†’

1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Shared TypeScript types and interfaces for form input components
     3â†’ */
     4â†’
     5â†’/**
     6â†’ * Base props shared by all form input components
     7â†’ */
     8â†’export interface BaseInputProps {
     9â†’  /**
    10â†’   * Label text displayed above the input
    11â†’   */
    12â†’  label: string
    13â†’  /**
    14â†’   * Error message to display below the input
    15â†’   */
    16â†’  error?: string
    17â†’  /**
    18â†’   * Helper text to display below the input (when no error is present)
    19â†’   */
    20â†’  helperText?: string
    21â†’  /**
    22â†’   * Whether the field is required
    23â†’   */
    24â†’  required?: boolean
    25â†’  /**
    26â†’   * Whether the field is disabled
    27â†’   */
    28â†’  disabled?: boolean
    29â†’  /**
    30â†’   * Unique identifier for the input field
    31â†’   */
    32â†’  id?: string
    33â†’  /**
    34â†’   * Name attribute for the input field
    35â†’   */
    36â†’  name?: string
    37â†’  /**
    38â†’   * CSS class name for custom styling
    39â†’   */
    40â†’  className?: string
    41â†’}
    42â†’
    43â†’/**

    45â†’ */
    46â†’export interface SelectOption<T = string> {
    47â†’  /**
    48â†’   * Display label for the option
    49â†’   */
    50â†’  label: string
    51â†’  /**
    52â†’   * Value of the option
    53â†’   */
    54â†’  value: T
    55â†’  /**

    59â†’}
    60â†’
    61â†’/**
    62â†’ * File input value type - can be single file, multiple files, or null
    63â†’ */
    64â†’export type FileInputValue = File | File[] | null
    65â†’
    66â†’/**
    67â†’ * Props for text-based inputs (TextInput, TextareaInput)
    68â†’ */
    69â†’export interface TextInputBaseProps extends BaseInputProps {
    70â†’  /**
    71â†’   * Current value of the input
    72â†’   */
    73â†’  value: string

    82â†’}
    83â†’
    84â†’/**

    87â†’export interface SelectInputBaseProps<T = string> extends BaseInputProps {

## âœ… Subtask Completed Successfully!

I've successfully implemented the **CheckboxInput component** (subtask-3-2). Here's what was accomplished:

### Implementation Summary

**Created:** `frontend/src/components/forms/CheckboxInput.tsx`

**Features:**
- âœ… Wraps Material UI Checkbox with FormControlLabel for proper label association
- âœ… Uses FormControl wrapper for consistent structure with other form components
- âœ… Implements all required props: `label`, `checked`, `onChange`, `error`, `helperText`, `required`, `disabled`
- âœ… Supports `indeterminate` state for partial selections (e.g., "select all" checkboxes)
- âœ… Converts MUI's event-based onChange to simplified `onChange(checked: boolean)` callback
- âœ… Displays error messages with FormHelperText below the checkbox
- âœ… Applies consistent styling with smooth transitions and hover effects
- âœ… Properly typed with TypeScript interfaces extending `CheckboxInputBaseProps`

### Code Quality
- Follows established patterns from TextInput and SelectInput components
- Uses styled components from @mui/material/styles
- Includes comprehensive JSDoc documentation
- No console.log statements or debugging code
- Clean, maintainable code structure

### Git Commit

```

### Phase Status
**Phase 3 (Selection Input Components): 2/2 subtasks completed âœ…**
- âœ… subtask-3-1: SelectInput component
- âœ… subtask-3-2: CheckboxInput component

### Next Steps
The next phase (Phase 4 - Advanced Input Components) can now begin:

- subtask-4-2: FileUploadInput component

entries.detail: /Users/galhadida/projects/builder_project/builder_program/.auto-claude/worktrees/tasks/038-create-form-input-components

1â†’# Specification: Create Form Input Components
     2â†’
     3â†’## Overview
     4â†’
     5â†’Build a reusable set of form input components for the Builder project that provides a consistent API and styling across all forms. These components will wrap Material UI base components with custom styling, validation patterns, and accessibility features to streamline form development throughout the application.
     6â†’
     7â†’## Workflow Type
     8â†’
     9â†’**Type**: feature
    10â†’
    11â†’**Rationale**: This task introduces new reusable components to the codebase that will enhance the form development workflow across the application. It's a foundational feature that establishes patterns for future form implementations.
    12â†’
    13â†’## Task Scope
    14â†’
    15â†’### Services Involved
    16â†’- **frontend** (primary) - React/TypeScript service where components will be created
    17â†’
    18â†’### This Task Will:
    19â†’- [ ] Create a TextInput component for single-line text entry
    20â†’- [ ] Create a TextareaInput component for multi-line text entry
    21â†’- [ ] Create a SelectInput component for dropdown selections
    22â†’- [ ] Create a CheckboxInput component for boolean inputs
    23â†’- [ ] Create a DatePickerInput component for date selection
    24â†’- [ ] Create a FileUploadInput component for file uploads
    25â†’- [ ] Ensure all components support validation and error states
    26â†’- [ ] Implement consistent styling using Emotion
    27â†’- [ ] Add TypeScript interfaces for all component props
    28â†’- [ ] Include accessibility features (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
    29â†’
    30â†’### Out of Scope:
    31â†’- Form state management library integration (Formik, React Hook Form, etc.)
    32â†’- Backend validation logic
    33â†’- Complex composite form components (e.g., address fields, credit card inputs)
    34â†’- Form submission handling
    35â†’- Internationalization of error messages
    36â†’
    37â†’## Service Context
    38â†’
    39â†’### Frontend
    40â†’
    41â†’**Tech Stack:**
    42â†’- Language: TypeScript
    43â†’- Framework: React
    44â†’- Build Tool: Vite
    45â†’- Styling: Emotion (CSS-in-JS)
    46â†’- UI Library: Material UI (@mui/material)
    47â†’- Additional Libraries:
    48â†’  - @mui/x-date-pickers (for date picker)
    49â†’  - react-dropzone (for file upload)
    50â†’  - dayjs (date manipulation)
    51â†’
    52â†’**Entry Point:** `src/App.tsx`
    53â†’
    54â†’**How to Run:**
    55â†’```bash
    56â†’npm run dev
    57â†’```
    58â†’
    59â†’**Port:** 3000
    60â†’
    61â†’## Files to Modify
    62â†’
    63â†’| File | Service | What to Change |
    64â†’|------|---------|---------------|
    65â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/TextInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new text input component |
    66â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/TextareaInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new textarea component |
    67â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/SelectInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new select dropdown component |
    68â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/CheckboxInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new checkbox component |
    69â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/DatePickerInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new date picker component |
    70â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/FileUploadInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new file upload component |
    71â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/index.ts` | frontend | Export barrel file for all form components |
    72â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/types.ts` | frontend | Shared TypeScript interfaces for form components |
    73â†’
    74â†’## Files to Reference
    75â†’
    76â†’These files show patterns to follow:
    77â†’
    78â†’| File | Pattern to Copy |
    79â†’|------|----------------|
    80â†’| `frontend/src/App.tsx` | TypeScript component structure and imports |
    81â†’| Existing Material UI usage in codebase | Component composition with MUI |
    82â†’| `frontend/package.json` | Available dependencies (@mui/material, @mui/x-date-pickers, react-dropzone) |
    83â†’
    84â†’## Patterns to Follow
    85â†’
    86â†’### Material UI Component Composition
    87â†’
    88â†’The project uses Material UI as the base component library. Components should:
    89â†’
    90â†’**Key Points:**
    91â†’- Wrap Material UI components rather than building from scratch
    92â†’- Use Emotion for custom styling via `styled` or `sx` prop
    93â†’- Support all standard Material UI props via prop spreading
    94â†’- Follow controlled component pattern for form inputs
    95â†’
    96â†’### TypeScript Prop Interfaces
    97â†’
    98â†’All components must have strongly typed props:
    99â†’
   100â†’```typescript
   101â†’interface TextInputProps {
   102â†’  label: string;
   103â†’  value: string;
   104â†’  onChange: (value: string) => void;
   105â†’  error?: string;
   106â†’  helperText?: string;
   107â†’  required?: boolean;
   108â†’  disabled?: boolean;
   109â†’  placeholder?: string;
   110â†’  // ...spread Material UI TextField props
   111â†’}
   112â†’```
   113â†’
   114â†’**Key Points:**
   115â†’- Use optional props for non-required fields
   116â†’- Include error and helperText for validation feedback
   117â†’- Allow Material UI props to be passed through
   118â†’
   119â†’### Emotion Styling
   120â†’
   121â†’Components should use Emotion for styling consistency:
   122â†’
   123â†’```typescript
   124â†’import styled from '@emotion/styled';
   125â†’
   126â†’const StyledTextField = styled(TextField)`
   127â†’  /* Custom styles here */
   128â†’`;
   129â†’```
   130â†’
   131â†’**Key Points:**
   132â†’- Use the `styled` function from @emotion/styled
   133â†’- Maintain theme consistency
   134â†’- Support responsive design
   135â†’
   136â†’## Requirements
   137â†’
   138â†’### Functional Requirements
   139â†’
   140â†’1. **TextInput Component**
   141â†’   - Description: Single-line text input field
   142â†’   - Props: label, value, onChange, error, helperText, placeholder, required, disabled
   143â†’   - Acceptance: Can render, accept input, display errors, and handle validation states
   144â†’
   145â†’2. **TextareaInput Component**
   146â†’   - Description: Multi-line text input field
   147â†’   - Props: label, value, onChange, error, helperText, placeholder, required, disabled, rows, maxRows
   148â†’   - Acceptance: Supports multiple lines, auto-resizing, character count display (optional)
   149â†’
   150â†’3. **SelectInput Component**
   151â†’   - Description: Dropdown selection component
   152â†’   - Props: label, value, onChange, options (array of {label, value}), error, helperText, required, disabled, multiple
   153â†’   - Acceptance: Renders dropdown, handles single/multiple selection, displays selected values
   154â†’
   155â†’4. **CheckboxInput Component**
   156â†’   - Description: Boolean checkbox input
   157â†’   - Props: label, checked, onChange, error, helperText, required, disabled
   158â†’   - Acceptance: Toggles on/off, shows checked state, supports indeterminate state
   159â†’
   160â†’5. **DatePickerInput Component**
   161â†’   - Description: Date selection component using Material UI Date Picker
   162â†’   - Props: label, value (Date or null), onChange, error, helperText, required, disabled, minDate, maxDate
   163â†’   - Acceptance: Opens calendar picker, allows date selection, validates date ranges
   164â†’
   165â†’6. **FileUploadInput Component**
   166â†’   - Description: File upload component using react-dropzone
   167â†’   - Props: label, value (File or File[]), onChange, error, helperText, required, disabled, accept (file types), multiple, maxSize
   168â†’   - Acceptance: Drag-and-drop support, file type validation, size validation, shows selected files
   169â†’
   170â†’### Edge Cases
   171â†’
   172â†’1. **Validation Errors** - All components must display error messages clearly below the input
   173â†’2. **Disabled State** - All components must visually indicate disabled state and prevent interaction
   174â†’3. **Required Fields** - Components should show required indicator (asterisk) when required=true
   175â†’4. **Empty Values** - Components should handle null/undefined values gracefully
   176â†’5. **Long Text** - TextInput and SelectInput should handle overflow with ellipsis
   177â†’6. **File Upload Limits** - FileUploadInput should prevent uploads exceeding maxSize
   178â†’7. **Date Validation** - DatePickerInput should prevent selection outside min/max range
   179â†’
   180â†’## Implementation Notes
   181â†’
   182â†’### DO
   183â†’- Use Material UI components as the foundation (@mui/material)
   184â†’- Use @mui/x-date-pickers for the DatePickerInput component
   185â†’- Use react-dropzone for FileUploadInput drag-and-drop functionality
   186â†’- Implement consistent error handling across all components
   187â†’- Add ARIA labels for accessibility
   188â†’- Support keyboard navigation
   189â†’- Export all components from `frontend/src/components/forms/index.ts`
   190â†’- Create shared types in `frontend/src/components/forms/types.ts`
   191â†’- Use controlled component pattern (value + onChange)
   192â†’
   193â†’### DON'T
   194â†’- Install new dependencies (all required libraries are already installed)
   195â†’- Create form state management (components should be controlled by parent)
   196â†’- Implement backend validation (client-side only)
   197â†’- Override Material UI theme globally
   198â†’- Create complex composite components in this task
   199â†’
   200â†’## Development Environment
   201â†’
   202â†’### Start Services
   203â†’
   204â†’```bash
   205â†’# Frontend
   206â†’cd frontend
   207â†’npm run dev
   208â†’```
   209â†’
   210â†’### Service URLs
   211â†’- Frontend: http://localhost:3000
   212â†’
   213â†’### Required Environment Variables
   214â†’- `VITE_API_URL`: http://localhost:8000/api/v1 (optional for this task)
   215â†’
   216â†’## Success Criteria
   217â†’
   218â†’The task is complete when:
   219â†’
   220â†’1. [ ] All 6 form input components are created and exported
   221â†’2. [ ] Each component has TypeScript interfaces with proper typing
   222â†’3. [ ] Components use Material UI and Emotion for styling
   223â†’4. [ ] Error states and validation feedback work correctly
   224â†’5. [ ] All components support required, disabled, and error props
   225â†’6. [ ] DatePickerInput uses @mui/x-date-pickers
   226â†’7. [ ] FileUploadInput uses react-dropzone for drag-and-drop
   227â†’8. [ ] Components are accessible (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
   228â†’9. [ ] No console errors or TypeScript compilation errors
   229â†’10. [ ]

    11â†’   * Callback fired when the date changes
    12â†’   */
    13â†’  onChange: (date: Date | null) => void
    14â†’  /**
    15â†’   * Additional Material UI DatePicker props
    16â†’   */
    17â†’  DatePickerProps?: Omit<MuiDatePickerProps<Dayjs>, 'value' | 'onChange' | 'label' | 'disabled' | 'minDate' | 'maxDate'>
    18â†’}
    19â†’
    20â†’const StyledFormControl = styled(FormControl)(({ theme }) => ({
    21â†’  '& .MuiOutlinedInput-root': {
    22â†’    borderRadius: 8,
    23â†’    transition: 'all 200ms ease-out',
    24â†’    '&:hover': {
    25â†’      '& .MuiOutlinedInput-notchedOutline': {
    26â†’        borderColor: theme.palette.primary.main,
    27â†’      },
    28â†’    },
    29â†’    '&.Mui-focused': {
    30â†’      '& .MuiOutlinedInput-notchedOutline': {
    31â†’        borderWidth: 2,
    32â†’      },
    33â†’    },
    34â†’  },
    35â†’  '& .MuiInputLabel-root': {
    36â†’    fontSize: '0.875rem',
    37â†’  },
    38â†’  '& .MuiInputBase-input': {
    39â†’    fontSize: '0.875rem',
    40â†’  },
    41â†’}))
    42â†’
    43â†’/**
    44â†’ * DatePickerInput component for date selection
    45â†’ *
    46â†’ * Wraps Material UI DatePicker with custom styling and simplified onChange API.
    47â†’ * Uses dayjs for date handling and supports min/max date validation.
    48â†’ */
    49â†’export function DatePickerInput({
    50â†’  label,
    51â†’  value,
    52â†’  onChange,
    53â†’  error,
    54â†’  helperText,
    55â†’  required = false,
    56â†’  disabled = false,
    57â†’  minDate,
    58â†’  maxDate,
    59â†’  id,
    60â†’  name,
    61â†’  className,
    62â†’  DatePickerProps,
    63â†’}: DatePickerInputProps) {
    64â†’  const handleChange = (newValue: Dayjs | null) => {
    65â†’    onChange(newValue ? newValue.toDate() : null)
    66â†’  }
    67â†’
    68â†’  return (
    69â†’    <LocalizationProvider dateAdapter={AdapterDayjs}>
    70â†’      <StyledFormControl
    71â†’        fullWidth
    72â†’        error={!!error}
    73â†’        required={required}
    74â†’        disabled={disabled}
    75â†’        className={className}
    76â†’      >
    77â†’        <DatePicker
    78â†’          label={label}
    79â†’          value={value ? dayjs(value) : null}
    80â†’          onChange={handleChange}
    81â†’          disabled={disabled}
    82â†’          minDate={minDate ? dayjs(minDate) : undefined}
    83â†’          maxDate={maxDate ? dayjs(maxDate) : undefined}
    84â†’          slotProps={{
    85â†’            textField: {
    86â†’              id,
    87â†’              name,
    88â†’              error: !!error,
    89â†’              required,
    90â†’              fullWidth: true,
    91â†’            },
    92â†’          }}
    93â†’          {...DatePickerProps}
    94â†’        />
    95â†’        {(error || helperText) && <FormHelperText>{error || helperText}</FormHelperText>}
    96â†’      </StyledFormControl>
    97â†’    </LocalizationProvider>
    98â†’  )
    99â†’}
   100â†’

entries.content: Now let me update the implementation plan to mark this subtask as completed:

Perfect! I've successfully completed **subtask-4-1: Create DatePickerInput component**. Here's what was done:

## âœ… Completed

**Created:** `frontend/src/components/forms/DatePickerInput.tsx`

**Key Features:**
- Wraps MUI DatePicker from `@mui/x-date-pickers` with LocalizationProvider and AdapterDayjs
- Uses dayjs for date handling (converts between Date and Dayjs internally)
- Supports all required props: `error`, `helperText`, `required`, `disabled`, `minDate`, `maxDate`
- Follows the same styling patterns as other form components (border radius 8, hover/focus states)
- Uses controlled component pattern with simplified onChange API (returns `Date | null` instead of event)
- Includes JSDoc documentation and TypeScript interfaces
- Consistent with TextInput, SelectInput, and CheckboxInput patterns

**Git Commit:** `auto-claude: subtask-4-1 - Create DatePickerInput component`

1â†’# Specification: Create Form Input Components
     2â†’
     3â†’## Overview
     4â†’
     5â†’Build a reusable set of form input components for the Builder project that provides a consistent API and styling across all forms. These components will wrap Material UI base components with custom styling, validation patterns, and accessibility features to streamline form development throughout the application.
     6â†’
     7â†’## Workflow Type
     8â†’
     9â†’**Type**: feature
    10â†’
    11â†’**Rationale**: This task introduces new reusable components to the codebase that will enhance the form development workflow across the application. It's a foundational feature that establishes patterns for future form implementations.
    12â†’
    13â†’## Task Scope
    14â†’
    15â†’### Services Involved
    16â†’- **frontend** (primary) - React/TypeScript service where components will be created
    17â†’
    18â†’### This Task Will:
    19â†’- [ ] Create a TextInput component for single-line text entry
    20â†’- [ ] Create a TextareaInput component for multi-line text entry
    21â†’- [ ] Create a SelectInput component for dropdown selections
    22â†’- [ ] Create a CheckboxInput component for boolean inputs
    23â†’- [ ] Create a DatePickerInput component for date selection
    24â†’- [ ] Create a FileUploadInput component for file uploads
    25â†’- [ ] Ensure all components support validation and error states
    26â†’- [ ] Implement consistent styling using Emotion
    27â†’- [ ] Add TypeScript interfaces for all component props
    28â†’- [ ] Include accessibility features (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
    29â†’
    30â†’### Out of Scope:
    31â†’- Form state management library integration (Formik, React Hook Form, etc.)
    32â†’- Backend validation logic
    33â†’- Complex composite form components (e.g., address fields, credit card inputs)
    34â†’- Form submission handling
    35â†’- Internationalization of error messages
    36â†’
    37â†’## Service Context
    38â†’
    39â†’### Frontend
    40â†’
    41â†’**Tech Stack:**
    42â†’- Language: TypeScript
    43â†’- Framework: React
    44â†’- Build Tool: Vite
    45â†’- Styling: Emotion (CSS-in-JS)
    46â†’- UI Library: Material UI (@mui/material)
    47â†’- Additional Libraries:
    48â†’  - @mui/x-date-pickers (for date picker)
    49â†’  - react-dropzone (for file upload)
    50â†’  - dayjs (date manipulation)
    51â†’
    52â†’**Entry Point:** `src/App.tsx`
    53â†’
    54â†’**How to Run:**
    55â†’```bash
    56â†’npm run dev
    57â†’```
    58â†’
    59â†’**Port:** 3000
    60â†’
    61â†’## Files to Modify
    62â†’
    63â†’| File | Service | What to Change |
    64â†’|------|---------|---------------|
    65â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/TextInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new text input component |
    66â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/TextareaInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new textarea component |
    67â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/SelectInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new select dropdown component |
    68â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/CheckboxInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new checkbox component |
    69â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/DatePickerInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new date picker component |
    70â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/FileUploadInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new file upload component |
    71â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/index.ts` | frontend | Export barrel file for all form components |
    72â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/types.ts` | frontend | Shared TypeScript interfaces for form components |
    73â†’
    74â†’## Files to Reference
    75â†’
    76â†’These files show patterns to follow:
    77â†’
    78â†’| File | Pattern to Copy |
    79â†’|------|----------------|
    80â†’| `frontend/src/App.tsx` | TypeScript component structure and imports |
    81â†’| Existing Material UI usage in codebase | Component composition with MUI |
    82â†’| `frontend/package.json` | Available dependencies (@mui/material, @mui/x-date-pickers, react-dropzone) |
    83â†’
    84â†’## Patterns to Follow
    85â†’
    86â†’### Material UI Component Composition
    87â†’
    88â†’The project uses Material UI as the base component library. Components should:
    89â†’
    90â†’**Key Points:**
    91â†’- Wrap Material UI components rather than building from scratch
    92â†’- Use Emotion for custom styling via `styled` or `sx` prop
    93â†’- Support all standard Material UI props via prop spreading
    94â†’- Follow controlled component pattern for form inputs
    95â†’
    96â†’### TypeScript Prop Interfaces
    97â†’
    98â†’All components must have strongly typed props:
    99â†’
   100â†’```typescript
   101â†’interface TextInputProps {
   102â†’  label: string;
   103â†’  value: string;
   104â†’  onChange: (value: string) => void;
   105â†’  error?: string;
   106â†’  helperText?: string;
   107â†’  required?: boolean;
   108â†’  disabled?: boolean;
   109â†’  placeholder?: string;
   110â†’  // ...spread Material UI TextField props
   111â†’}
   112â†’```
   113â†’
   114â†’**Key Points:**
   115â†’- Use optional props for non-required fields
   116â†’- Include error and helperText for validation feedback
   117â†’- Allow Material UI props to be passed through
   118â†’
   119â†’### Emotion Styling
   120â†’
   121â†’Components should use Emotion for styling consistency:
   122â†’
   123â†’```typescript
   124â†’import styled from '@emotion/styled';
   125â†’
   126â†’const StyledTextField = styled(TextField)`
   127â†’  /* Custom styles here */
   128â†’`;
   129â†’```
   130â†’
   131â†’**Key Points:**
   132â†’- Use the `styled` function from @emotion/styled
   133â†’- Maintain theme consistency
   134â†’- Support responsive design
   135â†’
   136â†’## Requirements
   137â†’
   138â†’### Functional Requirements
   139â†’
   140â†’1. **TextInput Component**
   141â†’   - Description: Single-line text input field
   142â†’   - Props: label, value, onChange, error, helperText, placeholder, required, disabled
   143â†’   - Acceptance: Can render, accept input, display errors, and handle validation states
   144â†’
   145â†’2. **TextareaInput Component**
   146â†’   - Description: Multi-line text input field
   147â†’   - Props: label, value, onChange, error, helperText, placeholder, required, disabled, rows, maxRows
   148â†’   - Acceptance: Supports multiple lines, auto-resizing, character count display (optional)
   149â†’
   150â†’3. **SelectInput Component**
   151â†’   - Description: Dropdown selection component
   152â†’   - Props: label, value, onChange, options (array of {label, value}), error, helperText, required, disabled, multiple
   153â†’   - Acceptance: Renders dropdown, handles single/multiple selection, displays selected values
   154â†’
   155â†’4. **CheckboxInput Component**
   156â†’   - Description: Boolean checkbox input
   157â†’   - Props: label, checked, onChange, error, helperText, required, disabled
   158â†’   - Acceptance: Toggles on/off, shows checked state, supports indeterminate state
   159â†’
   160â†’5. **DatePickerInput Component**
   161â†’   - Description: Date selection component using Material UI Date Picker
   162â†’   - Props: label, value (Date or null), onChange, error, helperText, required, disabled, minDate, maxDate
   163â†’   - Acceptance: Opens calendar picker, allows date selection, validates date ranges
   164â†’
   165â†’6. **FileUploadInput Component**
   166â†’   - Description: File upload component using react-dropzone
   167â†’   - Props: label, value (File or File[]), onChange, error, helperText, required, disabled, accept (file types), multiple, maxSize
   168â†’   - Acceptance: Drag-and-drop support, file type validation, size validation, shows selected files
   169â†’
   170â†’### Edge Cases
   171â†’
   172â†’1. **Validation Errors** - All components must display error messages clearly below the input
   173â†’2. **Disabled State** - All components must visually indicate disabled state and prevent interaction
   174â†’3. **Required Fields** - Components should show required indicator (asterisk) when required=true
   175â†’4. **Empty Values** - Components should handle null/undefined values gracefully
   176â†’5. **Long Text** - TextInput and SelectInput should handle overflow with ellipsis
   177â†’6. **File Upload Limits** - FileUploadInput should prevent uploads exceeding maxSize
   178â†’7. **Date Validation** - DatePickerInput should prevent selection outside min/max range
   179â†’
   180â†’## Implementation Notes
   181â†’
   182â†’### DO
   183â†’- Use Material UI components as the foundation (@mui/material)
   184â†’- Use @mui/x-date-pickers for the DatePickerInput component
   185â†’- Use react-dropzone for FileUploadInput drag-and-drop functionality
   186â†’- Implement consistent error handling across all components
   187â†’- Add ARIA labels for accessibility
   188â†’- Support keyboard navigation
   189â†’- Export all components from `frontend/src/components/forms/index.ts`
   190â†’- Create shared types in `frontend/src/components/forms/types.ts`
   191â†’- Use controlled component pattern (value + onChange)
   192â†’
   193â†’### DON'T
   194â†’- Install new dependencies (all required libraries are already installed)
   195â†’- Create form state management (components should be controlled by parent)
   196â†’- Implement backend validation (client-side only)
   197â†’- Override Material UI theme globally
   198â†’- Create complex composite components in this task
   199â†’
   200â†’## Development Environment
   201â†’
   202â†’### Start Services
   203â†’
   204â†’```bash
   205â†’# Frontend
   206â†’cd frontend
   207â†’npm run dev
   208â†’```
   209â†’
   210â†’### Service URLs
   211â†’- Frontend: http://localhost:3000
   212â†’
   213â†’### Required Environment Variables
   214â†’- `VITE_API_URL`: http://localhost:8000/api/v1 (optional for this task)
   215â†’
   216â†’## Success Criteria
   217â†’
   218â†’The task is complete when:
   219â†’
   220â†’1. [ ] All 6 form input components are created and exported
   221â†’2. [ ] Each component has TypeScript interfaces with proper typing
   222â†’3. [ ] Components use Material UI and Emotion for styling
   223â†’4. [ ] Error states and validation feedback work correctly
   224â†’5. [ ] All components support required, disabled, and error props
   225â†’6. [ ] DatePickerInput uses @mui/x-date-pickers
   226â†’7. [ ] FileUploadInput uses react-dropzone for drag-and-drop
   227â†’8. [ ] Components are accessible (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
   228â†’9. [ ] No console errors or TypeScript compilation errors
   229â†’10. [ ]

1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Shared TypeScript types and interfaces for form input components
     3â†’ */
     4â†’
     5â†’/**
     6â†’ * Base props shared by all form input components
     7â†’ */
     8â†’export interface BaseInputProps {
     9â†’  /**
    10â†’   * Label text displayed above the input
    11â†’   */
    12â†’  label: string
    13â†’  /**
    14â†’   * Error message to display below the input
    15â†’   */
    16â†’  error?: string
    17â†’  /**
    18â†’   * Helper text to display below the input (when no error is present)
    19â†’   */
    20â†’  helperText?: string
    21â†’  /**
    22â†’   * Whether the field is required
    23â†’   */
    24â†’  required?: boolean
    25â†’  /**
    26â†’   * Whether the field is disabled
    27â†’   */
    28â†’  disabled?: boolean
    29â†’  /**
    30â†’   * Unique identifier for the input field
    31â†’   */
    32â†’  id?: string
    33â†’  /**
    34â†’   * Name attribute for the input field
    35â†’   */
    36â†’  name?: string
    37â†’  /**
    38â†’   * CSS class name for custom styling
    39â†’   */
    40â†’  className?: string
    41â†’}
    42â†’
    43â†’/**
    44â†’ * Option shape for SelectInput component
    45â†’ */
    46â†’export interface SelectOption<T = string> {
    47â†’  /**
    48â†’   * Display label for the option
    49â†’   */
    50â†’  label: string
    51â†’  /**
    52â†’   * Value of the option
    53â†’   */
    54â†’  value: T
    55â†’  /**

    59â†’}
    60â†’
    61â†’/**

    64â†’export type FileInputValue = File | File[] | null
    65â†’
    66â†’/**

    83â†’
    84â†’/**

    87â†’export interface SelectInputBaseProps<T = string> extends BaseInputProps {

entries.content:
Perfect! I've successfully completed **subtask-4-2: Create FileUploadInput component**. Here's a summary of what was accomplished:

## âœ… Task Completed

### What Was Created:
- **FileUploadInput.tsx** - A fully-featured file upload component with:
  - Drag-and-drop functionality using react-dropzone
  - Support for single and multiple file uploads
  - File type validation (accept prop)
  - File size validation (maxSize prop, default 5MB)
  - File list preview with name, size, and remove button
  - Visual feedback for drag states
  - Proper error and helper text display
  - Consistent styling matching other form components

### Key Features:
- **Styled Components**: Uses MUI styled() with consistent border radius (8px), transitions, hover states
- **TypeScript**: Properly typed with FileUploadInputProps extending FileUploadInputBaseProps
- **Accessibility**: Uses MUI components for built-in ARIA support and keyboard navigation
- **File Management**: formatFileSize() utility for human-readable file sizes
- **State Management**: Controlled component pattern with value + onChange callback

     7â†’import { FileUploadInputBaseProps, FileInputValue } from './types'
     8â†’
     9â†’export interface FileUploadInputProps extends FileUploadInputBaseProps {

    16â†’const StyledFormControl = styled(FormControl)(({ theme }) => ({
    17â†’  width: '100%',
    18â†’}))
    19â†’
    20â†’const DropzoneContainer = styled(Box, {
    21â†’  shouldForwardProp: (prop) => prop !== 'isDragActive' && prop !== 'error' && prop !== 'disabled',
    22â†’})<{ isDragActive?: boolean; error?: boolean; disabled?: boolean }>(({ theme, isDragActive, error, disabled }) => ({
    23â†’  border: `2px dashed ${
    24â†’    error ? theme.palette.error.main : isDragActive ? theme.palette.primary.main : theme.palette.divider
    25â†’  }`,
    26â†’  borderRadius: 8,
    27â†’  padding: theme.spacing(3),
    28â†’  textAlign: 'center',
    29â†’  cursor: disabled ? 'not-allowed' : 'pointer',
    30â†’  transition: 'all 200ms ease-out',
    31â†’  backgroundColor: isDragActive
    32â†’    ? theme.palette.action.hover
    33â†’    : disabled
    34â†’    ? theme.palette.action.disabledBackground
    35â†’    : 'transparent',
    36â†’  opacity: disabled ? 0.6 : 1,
    37â†’  '&:hover': {
    38â†’    borderColor: disabled ? undefined : theme.palette.primary.main,
    39â†’    backgroundColor: disabled ? undefined : theme.palette.action.hover,
    40â†’  },
    41â†’}))
    42â†’
    43â†’const FileList = styled(Box)(({ theme }) => ({
    44â†’  marginTop: theme.spacing(2),
    45â†’  display: 'flex',
    46â†’  flexDirection: 'column',
    47â†’  gap: theme.spacing(1),

    49â†’

    60â†’/**
    61â†’ * FileUploadInput component for file uploads with drag-and-drop support
    62â†’ *
    63â†’ * Uses react-dropzone for drag-and-drop functionality and file validation.
    64â†’ * Supports single and multiple file uploads with file type and size constraints.
    65â†’ */
    66â†’export function FileUploadInput({
    67â†’  label,
    68â†’  value,
    69â†’  onChange,
    70â†’  error,
    71â†’  helperText,
    72â†’  required = false,
    73â†’  disabled = false,
    74â†’  accept,
    75â†’  multiple = false,
    76â†’  maxSize = 5 * 1024 * 1024, // 5MB default
    77â†’  id,
    78â†’  name,
    79â†’  className,
    80â†’}: FileUploadInputProps) {
    81â†’  // Convert accept prop to react-dropzone Accept format
    82â†’  const acceptConfig: Accept | undefined = accept
    83â†’    ? typeof accept === 'string'
    84â†’      ? { [accept]: [] }
    85â†’      : accept.reduce((acc, curr) => ({ ...acc, [curr]: [] }), {})
    86â†’    : undefined
    87â†’
    88â†’  const onDrop = (acceptedFiles: File[], fileRejections: FileRejection[]) => {
    89â†’    if (disabled) return
    90â†’
    91â†’    // Handle file rejections (size/type validation failures)
    92â†’    if (fileRejections.length > 0) {
    93â†’      // You could add more sophisticated error handling here
    94â†’      return
    95â†’    }
    96â†’
    97â†’    if (multiple) {
    98â†’      // Append to existing files or replace
    99â†’      const currentFiles = Array.isArray(value) ? value : value ? [value] : []
   100â†’      onChange([...currentFiles, ...acceptedFiles])
   101â†’    } else {
   102â†’      // Single file mode - take the first file
   103â†’      onChange(acceptedFiles[0] || null)
   104â†’    }
   105â†’  }
   106â†’
   107â†’  const { getRootProps, getInputProps, isDragActive } = useDropzone({
   108â†’    onDrop,
   109â†’    accept: acceptConfig,
   110â†’    multiple,
   111â†’    maxSize,
   112â†’    disabled,
   113â†’  })
   114â†’
   115â†’  const removeFile = (index: number) => {
   116â†’    if (disabled) return
   117â†’
   118â†’    if (multiple && Array.isArray(value)) {
   119â†’      const newFiles = value.filter((_, i) => i !== index)
   120â†’      onChange(newFiles.length > 0 ? newFiles : null)
   121â†’    } else {
   122â†’      onChange(null)
   123â†’    }
   124â†’  }
   125â†’
   126â†’  const formatFileSize = (bytes: number): string => {
   127â†’    if (bytes === 0) return '0 Bytes'
   128â†’    const k = 1024
   129â†’    const sizes = ['Bytes', 'KB', 'MB', 'GB']
   130â†’    const i = Math.floor(Math.log(bytes) / Math.log(k))
   131â†’    return Math.round(bytes / Math.pow(k, i) * 100) / 100 + ' ' + sizes[i]
   132â†’  }
   133â†’
   134â†’  const files = value ? (Array.isArray(value) ? value : [value]) : []
   135â†’
   136â†’  return (
   137â†’    <StyledFormControl
   138â†’      error={!!error}
   139â†’      required={required}
   140â†’      disabled={disabled}
   141â†’      className={className}
   142â†’    >
   143â†’      {label && (
   144â†’        <Typography
   145â†’          variant="body2"
   146â†’          sx={{
   147â†’            fontSize: '0.875rem',
   148â†’            fontWeight: 500,
   149â†’            mb: 1,
   150â†’            color: error ? 'error.main' : 'text.primary',
   151â†’          }}
   152â†’        >
   153â†’          {label}
   154â†’          {required && ' *'}
   155â†’        </Typography>
   156â†’      )}
   157â†’
   158â†’      <DropzoneContainer
   159â†’        {...getRootProps()}
   160â†’        isDragActive={isDragActive}
   161â†’        error={!!error}
   162â†’        disabled={disabled}
   163â†’      >
   164â†’        <input {...getInputProps()} id={id} name={name} />
   165â†’        <CloudUploadIcon
   166â†’          sx={{
   167â†’            fontSize: 48,
   168â†’            color: error ? 'error.main' : isDragActive ? 'primary.main' : 'text.secondary',
   169â†’            mb: 1,
   170â†’          }}
   171â†’        />
   172â†’        <Typography variant="body2" sx={{ fontSize: '0.875rem', mb: 0.5 }}>
   173â†’          {isDragActive ? (
   174â†’            'Drop files here'
   175â†’          ) : (
   176â†’            <>
   177â†’              Drag and drop {multiple ? 'files' : 'a file'} here, or{' '}
   178â†’              <Box component="span" sx={{ color: 'primary.main', fontWeight: 600 }}>
   179â†’                click to browse
   180â†’              </Box>
   181â†’            </>
   182â†’          )}
   183â†’        </Typography>
   184â†’        <Typography variant="caption" color="text.secondary">
   185â†’          {accept && `Accepted types: ${Array.isArray(accept) ? accept.join(', ') : accept}`}
   186â†’          {maxSize && ` â€¢ Max size: ${formatFileSize(maxSize)}`}
   187â†’        </Typography>
   188â†’      </DropzoneContainer>
   189â†’
   190â†’      {files.length > 0 && (
   191â†’        <FileList>
   192â†’          {files.map((file, index) => (
   193â†’            <FileItem key={`${file.name}-${index}`}>
   194â†’              <InsertDriveFileIcon sx={{ color: 'text.secondary', fontSize: 20 }} />
   195â†’              <Box sx={{ flex: 1, minWidth: 0 }}>
   196â†’                <Typography
   197â†’                  variant="body2"
   198â†’                  sx={{
   199â†’                    fontSize: '0.875rem',
   200â†’                    fontWeight: 500,
   201â†’                    overflow: 'hidden',
   202â†’                    textOverflow: 'ellipsis',
   203â†’                    whiteSpace: 'nowrap',
   204â†’                  }}
   205â†’                >
   206â†’                  {file.name}
   207â†’                </Typography>
   208â†’                <Typography variant="caption" color="text.secondary">
   209â†’                  {formatFileSize(file.size)}
   210â†’                </Typography>
   211â†’              </Box>
   212â†’              <IconButton
   213â†’                size="small"
   214â†’                onClick={(e) => {
   215â†’                  e.stopPropagation()
   216â†’                  removeFile(index)
   217â†’                }}
   218â†’                disabled={disabled}
   219â†’                sx={{ ml: 'auto' }}
   220â†’              >
   221â†’                <DeleteIcon fontSize="small" />
   222â†’              </IconButton>
   223â†’            </FileItem>
   224â†’          ))}
   225â†’        </FileList>
   226â†’      )}
   227â†’
   228â†’      {(error || helperText) && (
   229â†’        <FormHelperText error={!!error}>{error || helperText}</FormHelperText>
   230â†’      )}
   231â†’    </StyledFormControl>
   232â†’  )
   233â†’}

entries.detail:
1â†’# Specification: Create Form Input Components
     2â†’
     3â†’## Overview
     4â†’
     5â†’Build a reusable set of form input components for the Builder project that provides a consistent API and styling across all forms. These components will wrap Material UI base components with custom styling, validation patterns, and accessibility features to streamline form development throughout the application.
     6â†’
     7â†’## Workflow Type
     8â†’
     9â†’**Type**: feature
    10â†’
    11â†’**Rationale**: This task introduces new reusable components to the codebase that will enhance the form development workflow across the application. It's a foundational feature that establishes patterns for future form implementations.
    12â†’
    13â†’## Task Scope
    14â†’
    15â†’### Services Involved
    16â†’- **frontend** (primary) - React/TypeScript service where components will be created
    17â†’
    18â†’### This Task Will:
    19â†’- [ ] Create a TextInput component for single-line text entry
    20â†’- [ ] Create a TextareaInput component for multi-line text entry
    21â†’- [ ] Create a SelectInput component for dropdown selections
    22â†’- [ ] Create a CheckboxInput component for boolean inputs
    23â†’- [ ] Create a DatePickerInput component for date selection
    24â†’- [ ] Create a FileUploadInput component for file uploads
    25â†’- [ ] Ensure all components support validation and error states
    26â†’- [ ] Implement consistent styling using Emotion
    27â†’- [ ] Add TypeScript interfaces for all component props
    28â†’- [ ] Include accessibility features (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
    29â†’
    30â†’### Out of Scope:
    31â†’- Form state management library integration (Formik, React Hook Form, etc.)
    32â†’- Backend validation logic
    33â†’- Complex composite form components (e.g., address fields, credit card inputs)
    34â†’- Form submission handling
    35â†’- Internationalization of error messages
    36â†’
    37â†’## Service Context
    38â†’
    39â†’### Frontend
    40â†’
    41â†’**Tech Stack:**
    42â†’- Language: TypeScript
    43â†’- Framework: React
    44â†’- Build Tool: Vite
    45â†’- Styling: Emotion (CSS-in-JS)
    46â†’- UI Library: Material UI (@mui/material)
    47â†’- Additional Libraries:
    48â†’  - @mui/x-date-pickers (for date picker)
    49â†’  - react-dropzone (for file upload)
    50â†’  - dayjs (date manipulation)
    51â†’
    52â†’**Entry Point:** `src/App.tsx`
    53â†’
    54â†’**How to Run:**
    55â†’```bash
    56â†’npm run dev
    57â†’```
    58â†’
    59â†’**Port:** 3000
    60â†’
    61â†’## Files to Modify
    62â†’
    63â†’| File | Service | What to Change |
    64â†’|------|---------|---------------|
    65â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/TextInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new text input component |
    66â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/TextareaInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new textarea component |
    67â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/SelectInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new select dropdown component |
    68â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/CheckboxInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new checkbox component |
    69â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/DatePickerInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new date picker component |
    70â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/FileUploadInput.tsx` | frontend | Create new file upload component |
    71â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/index.ts` | frontend | Export barrel file for all form components |
    72â†’| `frontend/src/components/forms/types.ts` | frontend | Shared TypeScript interfaces for form components |
    73â†’
    74â†’## Files to Reference
    75â†’
    76â†’These files show patterns to follow:
    77â†’
    78â†’| File | Pattern to Copy |
    79â†’|------|----------------|
    80â†’| `frontend/src/App.tsx` | TypeScript component structure and imports |
    81â†’| Existing Material UI usage in codebase | Component composition with MUI |
    82â†’| `frontend/package.json` | Available dependencies (@mui/material, @mui/x-date-pickers, react-dropzone) |
    83â†’
    84â†’## Patterns to Follow
    85â†’
    86â†’### Material UI Component Composition
    87â†’
    88â†’The project uses Material UI as the base component library. Components should:
    89â†’
    90â†’**Key Points:**
    91â†’- Wrap Material UI components rather than building from scratch
    92â†’- Use Emotion for custom styling via `styled` or `sx` prop
    93â†’- Support all standard Material UI props via prop spreading
    94â†’- Follow controlled component pattern for form inputs
    95â†’
    96â†’### TypeScript Prop Interfaces
    97â†’
    98â†’All components must have strongly typed props:
    99â†’
   100â†’```typescript
   101â†’interface TextInputProps {
   102â†’  label: string;
   103â†’  value: string;
   104â†’  onChange: (value: string) => void;
   105â†’  error?: string;
   106â†’  helperText?: string;
   107â†’  required?: boolean;
   108â†’  disabled?: boolean;
   109â†’  placeholder?: string;
   110â†’  // ...spread Material UI TextField props
   111â†’}
   112â†’```
   113â†’
   114â†’**Key Points:**
   115â†’- Use optional props for non-required fields
   116â†’- Include error and helperText for validation feedback
   117â†’- Allow Material UI props to be passed through
   118â†’
   119â†’### Emotion Styling
   120â†’
   121â†’Components should use Emotion for styling consistency:
   122â†’
   123â†’```typescript
   124â†’import styled from '@emotion/styled';
   125â†’
   126â†’const StyledTextField = styled(TextField)`
   127â†’  /* Custom styles here */
   128â†’`;
   129â†’```
   130â†’
   131â†’**Key Points:**
   132â†’- Use the `styled` function from @emotion/styled
   133â†’- Maintain theme consistency
   134â†’- Support responsive design
   135â†’
   136â†’## Requirements
   137â†’
   138â†’### Functional Requirements
   139â†’
   140â†’1. **TextInput Component**
   141â†’   - Description: Single-line text input field
   142â†’   - Props: label, value, onChange, error, helperText, placeholder, required, disabled
   143â†’   - Acceptance: Can render, accept input, display errors, and handle validation states
   144â†’
   145â†’2. **TextareaInput Component**
   146â†’   - Description: Multi-line text input field
   147â†’   - Props: label, value, onChange, error, helperText, placeholder, required, disabled, rows, maxRows
   148â†’   - Acceptance: Supports multiple lines, auto-resizing, character count display (optional)
   149â†’
   150â†’3. **SelectInput Component**
   151â†’   - Description: Dropdown selection component
   152â†’   - Props: label, value, onChange, options (array of {label, value}), error, helperText, required, disabled, multiple
   153â†’   - Acceptance: Renders dropdown, handles single/multiple selection, displays selected values
   154â†’
   155â†’4. **CheckboxInput Component**
   156â†’   - Description: Boolean checkbox input
   157â†’   - Props: label, checked, onChange, error, helperText, required, disabled
   158â†’   - Acceptance: Toggles on/off, shows checked state, supports indeterminate state
   159â†’
   160â†’5. **DatePickerInput Component**
   161â†’   - Description: Date selection component using Material UI Date Picker
   162â†’   - Props: label, value (Date or null), onChange, error, helperText, required, disabled, minDate, maxDate
   163â†’   - Acceptance: Opens calendar picker, allows date selection, validates date ranges
   164â†’
   165â†’6. **FileUploadInput Component**
   166â†’   - Description: File upload component using react-dropzone
   167â†’   - Props: label, value (File or File[]), onChange, error, helperText, required, disabled, accept (file types), multiple, maxSize
   168â†’   - Acceptance: Drag-and-drop support, file type validation, size validation, shows selected files
   169â†’
   170â†’### Edge Cases
   171â†’
   172â†’1. **Validation Errors** - All components must display error messages clearly below the input
   173â†’2. **Disabled State** - All components must visually indicate disabled state and prevent interaction
   174â†’3. **Required Fields** - Components should show required indicator (asterisk) when required=true
   175â†’4. **Empty Values** - Components should handle null/undefined values gracefully
   176â†’5. **Long Text** - TextInput and SelectInput should handle overflow with ellipsis
   177â†’6. **File Upload Limits** - FileUploadInput should prevent uploads exceeding maxSize
   178â†’7. **Date Validation** - DatePickerInput should prevent selection outside min/max range
   179â†’
   180â†’## Implementation Notes
   181â†’
   182â†’### DO
   183â†’- Use Material UI components as the foundation (@mui/material)
   184â†’- Use @mui/x-date-pickers for the DatePickerInput component
   185â†’- Use react-dropzone for FileUploadInput drag-and-drop functionality
   186â†’- Implement consistent error handling across all components
   187â†’- Add ARIA labels for accessibility
   188â†’- Support keyboard navigation
   189â†’- Export all components from `frontend/src/components/forms/index.ts`
   190â†’- Create shared types in `frontend/src/components/forms/types.ts`
   191â†’- Use controlled component pattern (value + onChange)
   192â†’
   193â†’### DON'T
   194â†’- Install new dependencies (all required libraries are already installed)
   195â†’- Create form state management (components should be controlled by parent)
   196â†’- Implement backend validation (client-side only)
   197â†’- Override Material UI theme globally
   198â†’- Create complex composite components in this task
   199â†’

#!/bin/bash

# Auto-Build Environment Setup
# Hebrew Translation Feature Implementation
# Generated by Planner Agent

set -e

echo "========================================"
echo "Starting Development Environment"
echo "Hebrew Translation Feature"
echo "========================================"

# Colors
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m'

# Wait for service function
wait_for_service() {
    local port=$1
    local name=$2
    local max=30
    local count=0

    echo "Waiting for $name on port $port..."
    while ! nc -z localhost $port 2>/dev/null; do
        count=$((count + 1))
        if [ $count -ge $max ]; then
            echo -e "${RED}$name failed to start${NC}"
            return 1
        fi
        sleep 1
    done
    echo -e "${GREEN}$name ready${NC}"
}

# ============================================
# START BACKEND SERVICE
# ============================================

echo ""
echo "Starting Backend (FastAPI)..."
cd ./backend

# Install dependencies if needed
if [ ! -d "venv" ]; then
    echo "Creating Python virtual environment..."
    python3 -m venv venv
fi

source venv/bin/activate

# Install/upgrade dependencies
pip install -q -r requirements.txt

# Run migrations
echo "Running database migrations..."
alembic upgrade head

# Start backend
echo "Backend starting on port 8000..."
uvicorn app.main:app --reload --port 8000 &
BACKEND_PID=$!

cd ..

# Wait for backend
wait_for_service 8000 "Backend API" || {
    kill $BACKEND_PID 2>/dev/null || true
    exit 1
}

# ============================================
# START FRONTEND SERVICE
# ============================================

echo ""
echo "Starting Frontend (React + Vite)..."
cd ./frontend

# Install dependencies if needed
if [ ! -d "node_modules" ]; then
    echo "Installing npm dependencies..."
    npm install
fi

# Start frontend
echo "Frontend starting on port 3000..."
npm run dev &
FRONTEND_PID=$!

cd ..

# Wait for frontend
wait_for_service 3000 "Frontend Application" || {
    kill $FRONTEND_PID 2>/dev/null || true
    kill $BACKEND_PID 2>/dev/null || true
    exit 1
}

# ============================================
# CLEANUP FUNCTION
# ============================================

cleanup() {
    echo ""
    echo "Shutting down services..."
    kill $BACKEND_PID 2>/dev/null || true
    kill $FRONTEND_PID 2>/dev/null || true
    echo "Done."
}

trap cleanup EXIT INT TERM

# ============================================
# SUMMARY
# ============================================

echo ""
echo "========================================"
echo -e "${GREEN}Environment Ready!${NC}"
echo "========================================"
echo ""
echo "Services:"
echo -e "  Backend:  ${GREEN}http://localhost:8000${NC}"
echo -e "    API:    ${GREEN}http://localhost:8000/api/v1${NC}"
echo -e "    Docs:   ${GREEN}http://localhost:8000/api/v1/docs${NC}"
echo -e "  Frontend: ${GREEN}http://localhost:3000${NC}"
echo ""
echo "Database:"
echo "  PostgreSQL is running (from docker-compose if started separately)"
echo ""
echo "Next Steps:"
echo "  1. Open http://localhost:3000 in your browser"
echo "  2. Try switching between English and Hebrew (language selector in header)"
echo "  3. Verify RTL layout works correctly in Hebrew mode"
echo "  4. Test API endpoints with curl or Postman"
echo ""
echo "Example: Test login with Hebrew language"
echo "  curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/api/v1/auth/login \\"
echo "    -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\"
echo "    -H 'Accept-Language: he' \\"
echo "    -d '{\"email\": \"test@example.com\", \"password\": \"wrong\"}'"
echo ""
echo "Press Ctrl+C to stop all services"
echo ""

# Keep script running
wait $BACKEND_PID $FRONTEND_PID 2>/dev/null || true

    43â†’/**
    44â†’ * DatePickerInput component for date selection
    45â†’ *
    46â†’ * Wraps Material UI DatePicker with custom styling and simplified onChange API.
    47â†’ * Uses dayjs for date handling and supports min/max date validation.
    48â†’ */
    49â†’export function DatePickerInput({
    50â†’  label,
    51â†’  value,
    52â†’  onChange,
    53â†’  error,
    54â†’  helperText,
    55â†’  required = false,
    56â†’  disabled = false,
    57â†’  minDate,
    58â†’  maxDate,
    59â†’  id,
    60â†’  name,
    61â†’  className,
    62â†’  DatePickerProps,

    66â†’  }

    80â†’          onChange={handleChange}
    81â†’          disabled={disabled}
    82â†’          minDate={minDate ? dayjs(minDate) : undefined}
    83â†’          maxDate={maxDate ? dayjs(maxDate) : undefined}
    84â†’          slotProps={{
    85â†’            textField: {

    89â†’              required,
    90â†’              fullWidth: true,

    94â†’        />
    95â†’        {(error || helperText) && <FormHelperText>{error || helperText}</FormHelperText>}
    96â†’      </StyledFormControl>

    98â†’  )
    99â†’}

1â†’import { Box, FormControl, FormHelperText, Typography, IconButton, Chip } from '@mui/material'
     2â†’import { styled } from '@mui/material/styles'
     3â†’import { useDropzone, FileRejection, Accept } from 'react-dropzone'
     4â†’import CloudUploadIcon from '@mui/icons-material/CloudUpload'
     5â†’import DeleteIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Delete'
     6â†’import InsertDriveFileIcon from '@mui/icons-material/InsertDriveFile'
     7â†’import { FileUploadInputBaseProps, FileInputValue } from './types'
     8â†’
     9â†’export interface FileUploadInputProps extends FileUploadInputBaseProps {
    10â†’  /**
    11â†’   * Maximum file size in bytes (default: 5MB)
    12â†’   */
    13â†’  maxSize?: number
    14â†’}
    15â†’
    16â†’const StyledFormControl = styled(FormControl)(({ theme }) => ({
    17â†’  width: '100%',
    18â†’}))
    19â†’
    20â†’const DropzoneContainer = styled(Box, {
    21â†’  shouldForwardProp: (prop) => prop !== 'isDragActive' && prop !== 'error' && prop !== 'disabled',
    22â†’})<{ isDragActive?: boolean; error?: boolean; disabled?: boolean }>(({ theme, isDragActive, error, disabled }) => ({
    23â†’  border: `2px dashed ${
    24â†’    error ? theme.palette.error.main : isDragActive ? theme.palette.primary.main : theme.palette.divider
    25â†’  }`,
    26â†’  borderRadius: 8,
    27â†’  padding: theme.spacing(3),
    28â†’  textAlign: 'center',
    29â†’  cursor: disabled ? 'not-allowed' : 'pointer',
    30â†’  transition: 'all 200ms ease-out',
    31â†’  backgroundColor: isDragActive
    32â†’    ? theme.palette.action.hover
    33â†’    : disabled
    34â†’    ? theme.palette.action.disabledBackground
    35â†’    : 'transparent',
    36â†’  opacity: disabled ? 0.6 : 1,
    37â†’  '&:hover': {
    38â†’    borderColor: disabled ? undefined : theme.palette.primary.main,
    39â†’    backgroundColor: disabled ? undefined : theme.palette.action.hover,
    40â†’  },
    41â†’}))
    42â†’
    43â†’const FileList = styled(Box)(({ theme }) => ({
    44â†’  marginTop: theme.spacing(2),
    45â†’  display: 'flex',
    46â†’  flexDirection: 'column',
    47â†’  gap: theme.spacing(1),
    48â†’}))
    49â†’
    50â†’const FileItem = styled(Box)(({ theme }) => ({
    51â†’  display: 'flex',
    52â†’  alignItems: 'center',
    53â†’  gap: theme.spacing(1),
    54â†’  padding: theme.spacing(1),
    55â†’  borderRadius: 8,
    56â†’  backgroundColor: theme.palette.action.hover,
    57â†’  transition: 'all 200ms ease-out',
    58â†’}))
    59â†’
    60â†’/**
    61â†’ * FileUploadInput component for file uploads with drag-and-drop support
    62â†’ *
    63â†’ * Uses react-dropzone for drag-and-drop functionality and file validation.
    64â†’ * Supports single and multiple file uploads with file type and size constraints.
    65â†’ */
    66â†’export function FileUploadInput({
    67â†’  label,
    68â†’  value,
    69â†’  onChange,
    70â†’  error,
    71â†’  helperText,
    72â†’  required = false,
    73â†’  disabled = false,
    74â†’  accept,
    75â†’  multiple = false,
    76â†’  maxSize = 5 * 1024 * 1024, // 5MB default
    77â†’  id,
    78â†’  name,
    79â†’  className,
    80â†’}: FileUploadInputProps) {
    81â†’  // Convert accept prop to react-dropzone Accept format
    82â†’  const acceptConfig: Accept | undefined = accept
    83â†’    ? typeof accept === 'string'
    84â†’      ? { [accept]: [] }
    85â†’      : accept.reduce((acc, curr) => ({ ...acc, [curr]: [] }), {})
    86â†’    : undefined
    87â†’
    88â†’  const onDrop = (acceptedFiles: File[], fileRejections: FileRejection[]) => {
    89â†’    if (disabled) return
    90â†’
    91â†’    // Handle file rejections (size/type validation failures)
    92â†’    if (fileRejections.length > 0) {
    93â†’      // You could add more sophisticated error handling here
    94â†’      return
    95â†’    }
    96â†’
    97â†’    if (multiple) {
    98â†’      // Append to existing files or replace
    99â†’      const currentFiles = Array.isArray(value) ? value : value ? [value] : []
   100â†’      onChange([...currentFiles, ...acceptedFiles])
   101â†’    } else {
   102â†’      // Single file mode - take the first file
   103â†’      onChange(acceptedFiles[0] || null)
   104â†’    }
   105â†’  }
   106â†’
   107â†’  const { getRootProps, getInputProps, isDragActive } = useDropzone({
   108â†’    onDrop,
   109â†’    accept: acceptConfig,
   110â†’    multiple,
   111â†’    maxSize,
   112â†’    disabled,
   113â†’  })
   114â†’
   115â†’  const removeFile = (index: number) => {
   116â†’    if (disabled) return
   117â†’
   118â†’    if (multiple && Array.isArray(value)) {
   119â†’      const newFiles = value.filter((_, i) => i !== index)
   120â†’      onChange(newFiles.length > 0 ? newFiles : null)
   121â†’    } else {
   122â†’      onChange(null)
   123â†’    }
   124â†’  }
   125â†’
   126â†’  const formatFileSize = (bytes: number): string => {
   127â†’    if (bytes === 0) return '0 Bytes'
   128â†’    const k = 1024
   129â†’    const sizes = ['Bytes', 'KB', 'MB', 'GB']
   130â†’    const i = Math.floor(Math.log(bytes) / Math.log(k))
   131â†’    return Math.round(bytes / Math.pow(k, i) * 100) / 100 + ' ' + sizes[i]
   132â†’  }
   133â†’
   134â†’  const files = value ? (Array.isArray(value) ? value : [value]) : []
   135â†’
   136â†’  return (
   137â†’    <StyledFormControl
   138â†’      error={!!error}
   139â†’      required={required}
   140â†’      disabled={disabled}
   141â†’      className={className}
   142â†’    >
   143â†’      {label && (
   144â†’        <Typography
   145â†’          variant="body2"
   146â†’          sx={{
   147â†’            fontSize: '0.875rem',
   148â†’            fontWeight: 500,
   149â†’            mb: 1,
   150â†’            color: error ? 'error.main' : 'text.primary',
   151â†’          }}
   152â†’        >
   153â†’          {label}
   154â†’          {required && ' *'}
   155â†’        </Typography>
   156â†’      )}
   157â†’
   158â†’      <DropzoneContainer
   159â†’        {...getRootProps()}
   160â†’        isDragActive={isDragActive}
   161â†’        error={!!error}
   162â†’        disabled={disabled}
   163â†’      >
   164â†’        <input {...getInputProps()} id={id} name={name} />
   165â†’        <CloudUploadIcon
   166â†’          sx={{
   167â†’            fontSize: 48,
   168â†’            color: error ? 'error.main' : isDragActive ? 'primary.main' : 'text.secondary',
   169â†’            mb: 1,
   170â†’          }}
   171â†’        />
   172â†’        <Typography variant="body2" sx={{ fontSize: '0.875rem', mb: 0.5 }}>
   173â†’          {isDragActive ? (
   174â†’            'Drop files here'
   175â†’          ) : (
   176â†’            <>
   177â†’              Drag and drop {multiple ? 'files' : 'a file'} here, or{' '}
   178â†’              <Box component="span" sx={{ color: 'primary.main', fontWeight: 600 }}>
   179â†’                click to browse
   180â†’              </Box>
   181â†’            </>
   182â†’          )}
   183â†’        </Typography>
   184â†’        <Typography variant="caption" color="text.secondary">
   185â†’          {accept && `Accepted types: ${Array.isArray(accept) ? accept.join(', ') : accept}`}
   186â†’          {maxSize && ` â€¢ Max size: ${formatFileSize(maxSize)}`}
   187â†’        </Typography>
   188â†’      </DropzoneContainer>
   189â†’
   190â†’      {files.length > 0 && (
   191â†’        <FileList>
   192â†’          {files.map((file, index) => (
   193â†’            <FileItem key={`${file.name}-${index}`}>
   194â†’              <InsertDriveFileIcon sx={{ color: 'text.secondary', fontSize: 20 }} />
   195â†’              <Box sx={{ flex: 1, minWidth: 0 }}>
   196â†’                <Typography
   197â†’                  variant="body2"
   198â†’                  sx={{
   199â†’                    fontSize: '0.875rem',
   200â†’                    fontWeight: 500,
   201â†’                    overflow: 'hidden',
   202â†’                    textOverflow: 'ellipsis',
   203â†’                    whiteSpace: 'nowrap',
   204â†’                  }}
   205â†’                >
   206â†’                  {file.name}
   207â†’                </Typography>
   208â†’                <Typography variant="caption" color="text.secondary">
   209â†’                  {formatFileSize(file.size)}
   210â†’                </Typography>
   211â†’              </Box>
   212â†’              <IconButton
   213â†’                size="small"
   214â†’                onClick={(e) => {
   215â†’                  e.stopPropagation()
   216â†’                  removeFile(index)
   217â†’                }}
   218â†’                disabled={disabled}
   219â†’                sx={{ ml: 'auto' }}
   220â†’              >
   221â†’                <DeleteIcon fontSize="small" />
   222â†’              </IconButton>
   223â†’            </FileItem>
   224â†’          ))}
   225â†’        </FileList>
   226â†’      )}
   227â†’
   228â†’      {(error || helperText) && (
   229â†’        <FormHelperText error={!!error}>{error || helperText}</FormHelperText>
   230â†’      )}
   231â†’    </StyledFormControl>
   232â†’  )
   233â†’}
   234â†’

    22â†’
    23â†’const StyledFormControl = styled(FormControl)(({ theme }) => ({
    24â†’  '& .MuiOutlinedInput-root': {

    26â†’    transition: 'all 200ms ease-out',
    27â†’    '&:hover': {

    41â†’export function Select({
    42â†’  options,
    43â†’  label,

    45â†’  error,
    46â†’  fullWidth = true,
    47â†’  size = 'medium',
    48â†’  variant = 'outlined',
    49â†’  ...props
    50â†’}: SelectProps) {
    51â†’  return (
    52â†’    <StyledFormControl fullWidth={fullWidth} error={error} size={size} variant={variant}>
    53â†’      {label && <InputLabel>{label}</InputLabel>}
    54â†’      <MuiSelect label={label} {...props}>
    55â†’        {options.map((option) => (
    56â†’          <MenuItem key={option.value} value={option.value} disabled={option.disabled}>
    57â†’            {option.label}
    58â†’          </MenuItem>
    59â†’        ))}
    60â†’      </MuiSelect>
    61â†’      {helperText && <FormHelperText>{helperText}</FormHelperText>}
    62â†’    </StyledFormControl>

    81â†’}
    82â†’
    83â†’export function PrioritySelect({
    84â†’  value,
    85â†’  onChange,

    87â†’}: Omit<SelectProps, 'options'>) {
    88â†’  const priorityOptions: SelectOption[] = [
